intro: Mirabilis oxybaphoides var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-flowered four-o'clock, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the late afternoon. The plant produces vibrant pink to red blooms, which attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are typically hairy as well. This variety is appreciated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
